page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: We visited two farms in our area. Brickhouse Farm stands almost in the centre of the area and has 500 acres which is entirely arable and this year was put down either to wheat or barley. Stanstead Lodge Farm was a smaller mixed farm of 170 acres. There has been a farm here for over 400 years and the old moat pond has been here for the same period. It used to contain fish which wandering monks were free to catch. Most of the 170 acres were given over to arable farming, and this year the crops were peas, barley and two types of wheat - ordinary wheat for making bread and Durum wheat for the manu- facture of pasta.
